items.a: Thesara is a platform for quickly and easily publishing apps in a few clicks. The focus is on making your app available to users worldwide and giving your creativity a place to park.

items.q: What kinds of apps can I publish?
items.a: Any app that stays within a respectful boundary — no hate, scams, theft or lies. Technically, apps you build with LLMs (like ChatGPT and similar systems) will work here as well.

items.q: How do I publish an app?
items.a: Click the green 'Publish App' button, paste the code you copied from ChatGPT or another LLM, or upload the bundle you downloaded. Add a title, description, choose an image and publish. Then wait for our review and approval — that's it!
Publishing can take from a few minutes to a few hours. We're working to speed things up — still young, still improving — so it will get faster over time!

Publishing fails only if we reject the app — you'll get a notification. If the app is published but doesn't behave as expected, use the 'Report Problem' button in the app details to describe the issue and we'll investigate.

items.q: Where are my builds and uploads stored?
items.a: Builds are stored in the Thesara system, but keep your originals — we don't take responsibility for backups or permanent storage of your apps.
If an upload fails, please email reports@thesara.space and we'll check what happened. Uploads should normally succeed.

items.q: How can I use my app?
items.a: You can keep an app private or make it available to everyone. You can offer it for free or set a monthly price — for individual apps or your whole repository. Other users can access everything you publish for one price. We take a 30% commission; see Terms in the footer for details.
You can request a payout once you have at least $50 in your account. Transaction fees depend on the payout service and will be shown during the payout process.

items.q: How can I send a suggestion?
items.a: Use the 'Your suggestions' link on the homepage — click and send whatever comes to mind. We love ideas, especially those that help Thesara improve!

items.q: Where can I find more guidance?
items.a: Find more info in this FAQ or contact us directly at support@thesara.space.
A short program for enthusiasts who want to promote Thesara. Sign up via the form in the UI and join the team building the future of creativity!
{site} is a marketplace for mini web apps and games. You can run them in the browser, like and share them, and as a creator you can publish in minutes.
Browsing is open, but to play/run, like and publish apps you need to sign in or register.
Basic usage is free. Advanced features and higher quotas are available on the Pro plan.
Sign in with Google or email + password. After sign‑in we create your profile to sync usage.

items.q: How do I delete my account?
items.a: Contact support or reach us via your profile — we can permanently delete your account and related data.
We store essential sign‑in data (email, name, avatar) and aggregated metrics (likes, views). We do not sell data to third parties.

items.q: How do I publish an app?
items.a: On the homepage click ‘Publish App’, upload a ZIP bundle or repo and follow the steps. You’ll get a preview, network policy, and fields for description, tags and price.
Apps undergo a safety review (automated + manual if needed). If something needs fixing, you’ll receive reasons and guidance.
Yes. Set a price in app details. Paid users or those with a PIN can play/run the app.

items.q: How do I build multi-user experiences (rooms, sessions)?
items.a: Enable "Thesara Storage" when publishing. In your project use our `@thesara/client` package and call `initializeThesara()` on startup. It returns a storage object with async `getItem`, `setItem` and `removeItem` helpers. If the host injects a global `window.thesara.storage`, the SDK picks it up immediately; otherwise it falls back to the postMessage handshake.
Free plan (up to 2 apps) and Gold plan with higher quotas and extras (e.g. larger uploads, priority review).
Creators set a price. After purchase, users get access (PIN or entitlement) and can play without limits.
If something doesn’t work, contact support within 14 days and we’ll help — including refunds where appropriate.
Apps run in a sandboxed iframe with a strict CSP, limiting network access, cookies and browser APIs.

items.q: What are network policies (No Net / Media Only / Open Net)?
items.a: No Net: no network calls. Media Only: images/CDN only. Open Net: broader access (with declared domains). The policy is shown on the app details.

items.q: How to report a problem or abuse?
items.a: Use ‘Report’ on the app details (if visible) or send us the URL and a short description via support.
Best with latest Chrome, Edge, Safari and Firefox. On mobile we recommend Chrome (Android) and Safari (iOS).

items.q: App loads slowly — what to do?
items.a: Check your connection and try again. If it persists, contact the creator via comments or support with the app URL.
Write via the support page or from your profile. Include the app URL and a short problem description.
We publish updates in the app and on our channels — look for ‘Changelog’ in the menu or follow us on social.
